holidays.name: World Emoji Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the fun, expressive, and colorful world of emojis that spice up our digital conversations.
holidays.origin: July 17 was chosen because the calendar emoji üìÖ typically shows this date on Apple's iOS dating back to 2013, marking the first announcement of the iCal application.
holidays.funFact: World Emoji Day was first celebrated in 2014 and has since become an annual event where new emojis are often previewed or launched.

holidays.name: National Tattoo Day (US)
holidays.description: A day to honor the art of tattoos, the artists who create them, and all those who wear their stories on their skin.
holidays.origin: Began as an informal celebration among tattoo communities in the United States and gained traction as a fun day to appreciate body art.
holidays.funFact: Tattooing is one of the oldest forms of body modification, with archaeological evidence dating back over 5,000 years!

holidays.name: Yellow Pig Day
holidays.description: A quirky, math-themed holiday celebrating the number 17, which is a prime number, with the yellow pig as its mascot.
holidays.origin: Started at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign by math enthusiasts and described in the humorous 'Yellow Pig' concept created by mathematician Ed Barbeau.

holidays.name: Gummi Worm Day
holidays.description: A sweet and chewy celebration of everyone's favorite gummy candy worm, perfect for indulging your candy cravings.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday created by candy lovers and marketers, spotlighted in the summer when candy sales often rise.
holidays.funFact: Gummi worms were the first gummy candies introduced in the US in the early 1980s and helped popularize the gummy candy craze!
